playn.core.gl

Class GLContext

  • java.lang.Object
    • playn.core.gl.GLContext
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    GL20Context

    public abstract class GLContext
extends Object

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  GLContext.Filter
      Used to configure texture image scaling.
      static class  GLContext.Stats
      Used to track and report rendering statistics.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      Scale scale
      The scale factor for HiDPI mode, or 1 if HDPI mode is not enabled.

      The (logical pixel) width and height of our view.
      int viewWidth
      The (logical pixel) width and height of our view.

    • Field Detail

      • viewWidth

        public int viewWidth
        The (logical pixel) width and height of our view.

      • viewHeight

        public int viewHeight
        The (logical pixel) width and height of our view.

      • scale

        public final Scale scale
        The scale factor for HiDPI mode, or 1 if HDPI mode is not enabled.

    • Method Detail

      • setSize

        public final void setSize(int width,
                          int height)
        Sets the view width to the specified width and height (in pixels). The framebuffer will potentially be larger than this size if a HiDPI scale factor is in effect.

      • setTextureFilter

        public abstract void setTextureFilter(GLContext.Filter minFilter,
                                      GLContext.Filter magFilter)
        Configures the filter function used when rendering scaled textures.
        Parameters:
        minFilter - the scaling to use when rendering textures that are scaled down.
        magFilter - the scaling to use when rendering textures that are scaled up.

      • getString

        public abstract String getString(int param)
        Returns the specified GL string parameter.

      • getInteger

        public abstract int getInteger(int param)
        Returns the specified GL integer parameter.

      • getFloat

        public abstract float getFloat(int param)
        Returns the specified GL float parameter.

      • getBoolean

        public abstract boolean getBoolean(int param)
        Returns the specified GL boolean parameter.

      • texImage2D

        public void texImage2D(Image image,
                       int target,
                       int level,
                       int internalformat,
                       int format,
                       int type)
        See http://www.khronos.org/opengles/sdk/docs/man/xhtml/glTexImage2D.xml

        The default implementation is based on Image.getRgb(int, int, int, int, int[], int, int) and will hand over an RGBA byte array. Please set the (internal)format and type parameters accordingly; they are mainly present for future support of different formats. The WebGL implementation will pass through all parameters.

      • texSubImage2D

        public void texSubImage2D(Image image,
                          int target,
                          int level,
                          int xOffset,
                          int yOffset,
                          int format,
                          int type)
        See http://www.khronos.org/opengles/sdk/docs/man/xhtml/glTexSubImage2D.xml

        The default implementation is based on Image.getRgb(int, int, int, int, int[], int, int) and will hand over a RGBA byte array. Please set the (internal)format and type parameters accordingly; they are mainly present for future support of different formats. The WebGL implementation will pass through all parameters.

      • createProgram

        public abstract GLProgram createProgram(String vertShader,
                                        String fragShader)
        Creates a shader program, for use by a single GLShader.
        Parameters:
        vertShader - the source code for the vertex shader.
        fragShader - the source code for the fragment shader.

      • createFloatBuffer

        public abstract GLBuffer.Float createFloatBuffer(int capacity)
        Creates a float buffer with the specified initial capacity.

      • createShortBuffer

        public abstract GLBuffer.Short createShortBuffer(int capacity)
        Creates a short buffer with the specified initial capacity.

      • createFramebuffer

        public int createFramebuffer(int tex)
        Creates a framebuffer that will render into the supplied texture. NOTE: this must be followed immediately by a call to bindFramebuffer(int,int,int) or pushFramebuffer(int, int, int).

      • deleteFramebuffer

        public abstract void deleteFramebuffer(int fbuf)
        Deletes the supplied frame buffer (which will have come from createFramebuffer(int)).

      • createTexture

        public abstract int createTexture(boolean repeatX,
                                  boolean repeatY,
                                  boolean mipmaps)
        Creates a texture with the specified repeat behavior.

      • createTexture

        public abstract int createTexture(int width,
                                  int height,
                                  boolean repeatX,
                                  boolean repeatY,
                                  boolean mipmaps)
        Creates a texture of the specified size, with the specified repeat behavior, into which we can subsequently render.

      • generateMipmap

        public abstract void generateMipmap(int tex)
        Generates mipmaps for the specified texture.

      • activeTexture

        public abstract void activeTexture(int glTextureN)
        Activates the specified texture unit.
        Parameters:
        glTextureN - the texture unit to active (e.g. GL20.GL_TEXTURE0).

      • bindTexture

        public abstract void bindTexture(int tex)
        Binds the specified texture.

      • destroyTexture

        public abstract void destroyTexture(int tex)
        Destroys the supplied texture.

      • startClipped

        public abstract boolean startClipped(int x,
                                     int y,
                                     int width,
                                     int height)
        Starts a series of drawing commands that are clipped to the specified rectangle (in view coordinates, not OpenGL coordinates). Thus must be followed by a call to endClipped() when the clipped drawing commands are done.
        Returns:
        whether the resulting clip rectangle is not empty

      • endClipped

        public abstract void endClipped()
        Ends a series of drawing commands that were clipped per a call to startClipped(int, int, int, int).

      • clear

        public abstract void clear(float r,
                           float g,
                           float b,
                           float a)
        Clears the bound framebuffer with the specified color.

      • checkGLError

        public abstract void checkGLError(String op)
        NOOP except when debugging, checks and logs whether any GL errors have occurred.

      • queueDestroyTexture

        public void queueDestroyTexture(int tex)
        Queues a texture to be destroyed on the GL thread.

      • queueDeleteFramebuffer

        public void queueDeleteFramebuffer(int fbuf)
        Queues a framebuffer to be destroyed on the GL thread.

      • queueClearShader

        public void queueClearShader(GLShader shader)
        Queues a custom shader to be cleaned up on the GL thread.

      • createTransform

        public InternalTransform createTransform()
        Creates an identity transform, which may subsequently be mutated.

      • rootTransform

        public abstract InternalTransform rootTransform()
        Returns the root transform which converts scale-independent coordinates into pixels. On some platforms this may also handle screen rotation. Do not modify!

      • bindFramebuffer

        public void bindFramebuffer(int fbuf,
                            int width,
                            int height)

      • bindFramebuffer

        public void bindFramebuffer()

      • pushFramebuffer

        public void pushFramebuffer(int fbuf,
                            int width,
                            int height)
        Stores the metadata for the currently bound frame buffer, and binds the supplied framebuffer. This must be followed by a call to popFramebuffer(). Also, it is not allowed to push a framebuffer if a framebuffer is already pushed. Only one level of nesting is supported.

      • popFramebuffer

        public void popFramebuffer()
        Pops the framebuffer pushed by a previous call to pushFramebuffer(int, int, int) and restores the framebuffer that was active prior to that call.

      • quadShader

        public GLShader quadShader(GLShader custom)
        Returns the supplied shader if non-null, or the default quad shader if null.

      • trisShader

        public GLShader trisShader(GLShader custom)
        Returns the supplied shader if non-null, or the default triangles shader if null.

      • flush

        public void flush()

      • flush

        public void flush(boolean deactivate)

      • useShader

        public boolean useShader(GLShader shader)
        Makes the supplied shader the current shader, flushing any previous shader.

      • stats

        public GLContext.Stats stats()
        Returns the current rendering stats. These will be all zeros unless the library was compiled with stats enabled (which is not the default).

      • quadShaderInfo

        public String quadShaderInfo()
        Returns debugging info on the quad shader. Useful for performance analysis.

      • trisShaderInfo

        public String trisShaderInfo()
        Returns debugging info on the triangles shader. Useful for performance analysis.
